name: Fabrication - Structural Glaze Fabrication QA Checklist
Template Name: Fabrication - Structural Glaze Fabrication QA Checklist

name: Cutting
Materials free of damage/distortion
Extrusion dimensions correct (+/- 1mm)
CNC Machining
Materials free of damage/distortion
Machine coding correct to assembly sheet
Assembly
Extrusion correct to assembly sheet
Panel configuration correct as per assembly sheets
Extrusion dimensions correct (+/- 1mm)
All required additional components Installed and fitted correctly
Rubbers continuous and free of damage
All joints are tightly fitted, prepared and sealed
Drain holes are as per drawings and free of debris
Backpans/louvres are fitted as per detail
Frame is clearly labelled in accordance with fabrication sheets
Overall panel dimensions correct (+/- 15mm up to 3mm overall)
Frame is clean from marks, scratches and fabrication debris
Hardware/Doors
Door operate smoothly and unobstructed
Correct hardware is fitted and operates smoothly
Glazing - Curtain Wall Glazing QA Checklist
Template Name: Glazing - Curtain Wall Glazing QA Checklist

name: Glass identified as correct type for location as per shop drawings
Backing rubbers continuous, sealed in corners and free of damage
Glazing Blocks set out as per NZS4223.3:2016 and correct type
Glass placed in opening, damage free as per NZS4223.3:2016
Safety stamp visible as per NZS4223.3:2016 (industry standard is bottom right from outside)
Beads securely fitted and damage free as per NZS4223.3:2016
Correct glazing wedge used and rubber of as per NZS4223.3:2016 ensuring there is no gaps and corners are sealed
Glass trade clean, free of defects and protection tape fitted where required
Installation - Flush Glaze & Curtain Wall Installation QA Checklist
Template Name: Installation - Flush Glaze & Curtain Wall Installation QA Checklist

name: Documentation Received
Received QA documents from window manufacturer
Received all relevant setout/survey drawings
Initial Inspection
Gridlines and RL's are visible and accessible
Installation area is free from obstruction and has suitable access
Seismic sill, Head, Jambs and Brackets
Opening structure correct at sill head and jambs
Waterproofing/wrapping complete around entire opening
Sill head, jamb fixings & splice fixings are fitted correctly as per specifications and to correct RL
Seismic frame inspected and defect free
Seismic sill, head & jambs levelled to correct height
All fixings, corner angles and splice plates are sealed and neatly tooled
Check primary brackets are seated correctly and are in the correct position, and all nuts and washers are correct as per design
Check primary brackets are torqued to correct setting 30Nm
Pre-Installation
Check panel identification with setout plans
Verify that the panel to be installed will be in the correct location
Visual inspection for any glass or sealant defects
Inspected for any other damage, eg: dents or scratches
Check that the gaskets are in place without damage or voids and that the gaskets are crimped both ends
Check that the sub sills are clean and free from debris
Installation
Check each panel is set to the correct height
Check each panel is plumb, leveled and true
Check that the gap between the mullions are as per design (within acceptable tolerance)
Check bracket is engaged correctly to the primary bracket
Check that the lock off angle is fitted correctly
Verify that the connecting spigot and front soaker are clean, sealed and neatly tooled
Check beads are fitted and are rubbered off
Horizontal and vertical air seals applied and neatly tooled
Horizontal and vertical weather seals applied and neatly tooled
Rain shield flashings are installed correctly
Head flashing is installed correctly
Parapet flashings are installed
